intro: Chamaesyce stoddartii, commonly known as Stoddart's sandmat, is a low-growing annual plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae, which includes many species of succulent plants. The plant has fleshy, ribbed leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs, adapted to conserve water in arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun conditions.
